column3: Definition
English
MOSDAC
December 12, 2017
Science product of eddy parameters over Bay of Bengal.
Characterizing Ocean Eddy activities in the Bay of Bengal using Altimeter data

The oceanic eddy parameter information over Bay of Bengal was prepared for 24 years (1993 – 2016) using AVISO merged and gridded satellite altimeter sea surface height (SSH) data. SSH anomaly at 7-day interval having special resolution of 0.25o has been used for present study.
M. Jishad, OSD/AOSG/EPSA, SAC (ISRO), Ahmedabad-380015, India. Ph: +91 79 2691 6117. Email: jishadm@sac.isro.gov.in

Physical Oceanography
Altimter, sea surface height, Oceanic eddy, Bay of Bengal, Cyclonic and anti-cyclonic
January 01 1993 to December 31 2016 weekly data
Jishad M, Rashmi Sharma and Neeraj Agarwal, Space Applications Centre (ISRO), Ahmedabad-380015, India
Space Applications Centre (ISRO), Ahmedabad, India
Mesoscale oceanic eddies have been identified and tracked in weekly merged altimeter product of Sea Surface Height (SSH) in the Bay of Bengal during the period 1993-2016.
